comment: Her exams are very similar to her review videos. I retook this class with her, and I found that she taught me much easier shortcuts and methods for solving problems. However, you are expected to use the textbook to learn in her online class, which I didn't find that helpful.
Super easy class. She gives reviews for each exam, just practice those and you'll ace the tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: If you take any other professor, you're doing yourself a disservice. I had her for Tuesdays and Thursdays, and whenever we had an exam, we would review (more or less) a replica of the exam on Tuesdays, and then have the rest of Tuesday and Wednesday to review it before the exam on Thursday. If you don't pass this class, it's completely your fault.

She genuinely has a gift for teaching. I was somebody who barely passed Calculus 1, yet she made the topics in Calculus 2 easy to comprehend.

Always attend the review sessions - they are very similar to her exams.

She was wonderful. She gives you a review for the exam and it is verbatim of what will be on the exam. If you study those problems, you will get an A on the exams every time. If you fail the class, it is because you tried to fail.

I'd give her a 6 if I could. Only HW, 4 tests, 1 final. Has a review for each test and the tests are the exact same w/ different numbers. Study the review over and over and you're guaranteed to pass. I barely passed Calc1 and got a 95 in this class. Very good lectures. A little hard to understand but if you go to class you'll do great.

I honestly have no idea how anyone would give her less than a 5. If you fail her class, it is your fault. The tests are EXACTLY like the reviews and there is a review for EVERY exam except the final. The lowest grade I got on a test was a 94. You do have to practice the problems but that is it. She also goes over every hw problem ever mentioned.

She was an awesome professor!! Her lectures and notes were very good, but you really have to attend the lectures to succeed even though she posts the notes afterwards. The only thing is that she's a little soft spoken so get a seat close to the front.
Even though examples are provided and questions are encouraged, she tends to go over examples pretty fast. Though, the class is still doable as long as you practice.

This is for course 2306. She gives in-depth lectures and examples, though she has a slight accent. She is willing to stop and go over examples if students are confused about a topic. She does give out homework for a grade, but it helps with understanding the material.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: great prof who uses a bunch of examples, which for math is amazing. they go through them kinda fast but will answer any questions and reexplain anything. study the review they do before exams and youll do well. i studied the way they recommended and did great. theyre also super nice and typically grade exams within a few days
Classes usually end early. Follow the study guide and you'll pass the test. Almost identical. Does go through the lecturing kind of fast though. SHOW UP to class. No extra-credit.
Clear Grading criteria, follow instructions in class and pay attention to her study guides! Amazing research professor, so kind and helpful!! Go to office hours!!

Math Lectures are the worst; goes through examples very quickly, and only occasionally stops to ask questions. Assumes a lot of knowledge and fails to disclose any actual information on what is happening within the equations. There is little to no discussion encouraged due to the speed of the class and most help is better off from a math tutor.
Go to class and do your work
